doc.previous: The following two identities are also usually regarded as axioms, even though they follow from the two absorption laws taken together.[note 1]
doc.after: These axioms assert that both (L,) and (L,) are semilattices. The absorption laws, the only axioms above in which both meet and join appear, distinguish a lattice from an arbitrary pair of semilattices and assure that the two semilattices interact appropriately. In particular, each semilattice is the dual of the other.
